newsitem.title: USA: Maxwell House cuts coffee prices by 30 cents a can.
newsitem.headline: Maxwell House cuts coffee prices by 30 cents a can.

text.p: Maxwell House Coffee Co. said Thursday it will cut the wholesale price of its standard 13-ounce cans of ground regular and ground decaffeinated coffees by 30 cents due to the decline in prices on the world's futures markets.
The decrease, which takes effect Sept. 8, brings the price for a standard 13-ounce can of regular ground coffee to $3.06, and decaffeinated ground Maxwell House to $3.76, the company said.
Maxwell House's price cut comes one day after Procter & Gamble unit Folgers Coffee Co. announced it would lower prices by 30 cents a can.
The price of green coffee on New York's Coffee, Sugar and Cocoa Exchange has fallen by some 40 percent from 20-year highs set in May.

Major roasters were forced to raise retail prices of ground coffee four times earlier this year -- from $2.41 to $3.36 a can -- to reflect the soaring cost of green coffee on the world's futures markets.
Maxwell House is a division of Philip Morris Co.'s Kraft Foods.
